Dear Helen Rowlands,
Thank you for your request for information relating to Non-residential
care charge increases which we received on 29/11/2023.
This has been logged as a Freedom of Information Request and will be dealt
with under the Freedom of Information Act 2000. The reference number for
your request can be found above.
The Freedom of Information Act 2000 states that we must respond to you
within 20 working days, by 29/12/2023. Please do not hesitate to contact
us at the email address below if you have any queries.
Yours sincerely,
Sheffield City Council

Dear Sheffield City Council,
Please provide the following information relating to the local authority's
non-residential social care services provision:
1. Non-residential / home care service charges: please provide the rates
charged by the authority for the following services, in the financial
years 2020-21; 2021-22, 2022-23, and 2023-24:
i. Homecare: please provide the hourly rate and the minimum unit rate, if
applicable; ii. Pendant alarms / Telecare: please provide the rates for
all levels of this service; iii. Day care: transport: please provide the
journey rate and the minimum rate, if applicable; iv. Day care: please
provide the daily and the minimum rate, if applicable.
2. Please confirm if your council has agreed to implement a raise in any
of these categories of charge from April 2024, and the agreed increase/s.
Yours faithfully,
Helen Rowlands

Dear Helen Rowlands,
Thank you for your request for information relating to Non-residential
care charge increases which we received on 29/11/2023.
Please see the response below.
Non-residential / home care service charges
1. Please provide the rates charged by the authority for the following
services, in the financial years 2020-21; 2021-22, 2022-23, and
2023-24:
i.               Homecare: please provide the hourly rate and the minimum
unit rate, if applicable; Average rates for framework:
• 20/21 = £17.23, 21/22 = £18.63, 22/23 = £19.05, 23/24 = £21ph
ii.              Pendant alarms / Telecare: please provide the rates for
all levels of this service;
• £21.42 pw across all 4 years
iii.             Day care: transport: please provide the journey rate and
the minimum rate, if applicable;
• There are no standard rates – they vary by the type of service
offered.
iv.            Day care: please provide the daily and the minimum rate, if
applicable.
• There are no standard rates – they vary by the type of service offered
and the type of support required.
2. Please confirm if your council has agreed to implement a raise in any
of these categories of charge from April 2024, and the agreed
increase/s.
• Day care – in line with CPI or on an individual basis.
• Homecare = 9.33%
• Telecare: No increase.
If you have any queries about this response, please do not hesitate to
contact us.
The information provided in this response is available for re-use under
the terms of the Open Government Licence v3.0. The terms of the OGL can be
found [1]here. When re-using the information, Sheffield City Council
requires you to include the following attribution statement: “Contains
public sector information obtained from Sheffield City Council and
licensed under the Open Government Licence v3.0.”
If you are unhappy with the response you have received in relation to your
request, you are entitled to have this reviewed. You can ask for an
internal review by replying to this email. Internal review requests should
be submitted within 40 working days from the date of this response.
If you remain dissatisfied with the outcome of your internal review, you
can contact the Information Commissioner’s Office. Please see
